Projetos de extensão
2011 - 2012
Impact of Sanitation and Hygiene Innovation Technologies
Descrição: Uganda ranks 161 out of 187 countries on the 2011 Human Development Index (HDI), and is among the ?low human development? countries. A major gap in child survival is infant and child mortality rates, which remain unacceptably high at 63 and 99 per 1,000 live births respectively (2010). Diarrhea - one of the top three killers of children under 5-years old in addition to pneumonia and measles - can be reduced and prevented by hand-washing with clean water and soap. Sanitation coverage in rural households has improved only from 68% to 70% (between 2009-2010); safe water coverage for the rural population stagnated at 65%. While hand-washing facilities in schools have improved over the same period (from 68% to 70%). People with access to hand washing facilities in the household fell from 22% to 21%. Key challenges include government funding allocations, local capacity gaps that impact functionality, and increasing water quality concerns. In the national level the hand washing practice remains low ~ 3% (Edward Bwengye). As set out in the UN Millennium Development Goals a number of achievements regarding basic facilities in the developing world are to be achieved by 2015. Target 7c is to halve, by 2015, the proportion of people without sustainable access to safe water and basic sanitation. Currently facilities and services are not increasing fast enough to meet this goal, with Sub-Saharan Africa making the least progress on this goal. The project's main goal is to improve access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene in schools in Uganda through one or more intuitive, sustainable products that are part of a larger system/service which is simple to construct using only resources readily available in Uganda..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Extensão.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (6) / Mestrado acadêmico: (10) .

Integrantes: João Marcos de Mattos Barguil - Integrante / Irena Bakic - Integrante / Palash Sarkar - Integrante / Thomas Hurd - Integrante / Hannele Kenkkila - Integrante / Lauri Saviranta - Integrante / Joong Yeol Park - Integrante / Lari Elovainio - Integrante / Heikki Soininen - Integrante / Panu Harju - Integrante / Heini Salovuori - Integrante / Andrew Clutterbuck - Coordenador / Kalevi Ekman - Integrante / Roderick Obeja - Integrante / Joel Tuliwangula - Integrante / Felix Fortune Mwebe - Integrante / Isabella Mugisa - Integrante / Pamella Akullo - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Aalto University - Auxílio financeiro / UNICEF Finland - Cooperação.
